The Architect (Wizard) CR5.name: The Architect (Wizard) CR5
The Architect (Wizard) CR5.description:
The Architect Quotes

Unstable

General Lines (Influenced by Any Aspect):

  1. "This... this isn’t right! Pieces... missing... too many cracks to hold together!"

  2. "I feel them! Pulling at me... too loud, too loud!" "Why did you do this? Why didn’t you listen? It’s broken—it’s all broken!"

Specific Influences:

  1. Scholar Influence: "Logic... fractured. Knowledge slipping through my hands! Why didn’t you fix it properly?"

  2. Visionary Influence: "You held me back! Too timid, too blind to what must be done! I could have achieved perfection!"

  3. Dreamer Influence: "Dreams... haunting me. Memories of what could have been. You should have let it go!"

  4. Curious Influence: "I can’t stop asking... what else? What could have been? Too many questions—no answers!"

  5. Coward Influence: "Fear... drowning me. Why didn’t you stop it? Why did you let this happen?"

Stable

  1. "You’ve restored me... Thank you for pulling me from the abyss."

  2. "What you’ve done here... it cannot have been easy. For that, you have my respect."

  3. "You’ve given me the chance to move forward, and for that, I am in your debt."

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
一束 100 尺长，5 尺宽的线状闪电从你的位置向你指定的任意方向爆发迸出。在线状区域内的每个生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免，豁免失败者将受到 8d6 的闪电伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。

闪电会将区域内未被着装或携带的可燃物件点燃。

升环施法： 使用四环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比三环高一环，伤害就增加 1d6。

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: 你触碰一个未着装护甲的自愿生物。直至法术终止前，目标的基础AC变为 13 + 它的敏捷调整值。当目标穿上护甲时，此法术将提前终止。

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description:
一道冰冷的蓝白色光线朝施法距离内的一个生物射去。你对目标进行一次远程法术攻击。若命中，则目标受到 1d8 点寒冷伤害，并且在你的下一回合开始前速度减少 10 尺。

你到达 5 级时，该法术的伤害增加 1d8（变为 2d8）。11 级时再加 1d8（变为 3d8），17 级时再加 1d8（变为 4d8）。

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description: Speed is reduced by 10ft until the start of your next turn.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
你创造三枚由魔法力场形成的闪光飞镖，并让每发飞镖袭向施法距离内你能看见的指定生物。每发飞镖对目标造成 1d4 + 1 点力场伤害。所有飞镖将同时袭向目标，而你还可以指定它们击中同一个目标或是分别击中几个目标。

升环施法： 使用的法术位每比一环高一环，该法术就会多制造出一支飞镖。

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. You can use your action to dismiss the illusory duplicates.

Each time a creature targets you with an attack during the spell's duration, roll a [[/r 1d20 # Mirror Image Check]] to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your duplicates.

If you have three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher to change the attack's target to a duplicate. With two duplicates, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one duplicate, you must roll an 11 or higher.

A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

A creature is unaffected by this spell if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description:
你试图打断一个生物正在施展的一个法术。如果该生物正在施展三环或更低环阶法术，则其法术失败且不产生任何效应。如果该生物正在施展四环或更高环阶法术，则你以施法属性进行一次属性检定，其检定 DC 等于 10 + 目标法术的环阶。检定成功则目标法术失败且不产生任何效应。

升环施法：使用四环或更高法术位施展该法术时，如果被打断法术的环阶不高于你所用的法术位环阶，则该目标法术直接被打断。

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: 你或一个你触碰的生物变为隐形，直至法术终止。任何保持在目标身上的着装物和携带物也可以维持隐形状态。

Greater Invisibility.name: Greater Invisibility
Greater Invisibility.description: The target becomes Invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is Invisible as long as it is on the target's person.

Void Channeling.name: Void Channeling
Void Channeling.description: Void Channeling. After the wizard casts a spell, up to two Voidling Elementals are summoned in unoccupied spaces within 10ft of him.

Stable Form.name: Stable Form
Stable Form.description: Stable Form. When the wizard loses all temporary HP, it will transform into its stable form.

Necrotic Pulse.name: Necrotic Pulse
Necrotic Pulse.description:
Necrotic Pulse (Recharge 5-6). The Coward emits a wave of necrotic magic. All creatures in a 15ft radius must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. A target takes 1d10 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Note: Use this only if the Coward is left outside of the experiment.

Euphoric Embrace.name: Euphoric Embrace
Euphoric Embrace.description:
Euphoric Embrace. The Dreamer emits a wave of euphoria. Creatures within 15ft must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 minute. Charmed creatures see the nearest creature as a threat and attack it on their turn. They can repeat the save at the end of their turns to end the effect.

Note: Use this only if the Dreamer is left outside of the experiment.

Mental Assault.name: Mental Assault
Mental Assault.description:
Mental Assault (Recharge 5-6). The Scholar targets up to two creatures within range that it can see. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw or be silenced for 1 minute. A silenced creature cannot speak, cast spells with verbal components, or communicate telepathically.

At the end of each of its turns, a silenced creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Note: Use this only if the Scholar is left outside of the experiment.

Motes of Force.name: Motes of Force
Motes of Force.description:
Motes of Force. The Visionary conjures motes of force energy, targeting up to five different creatures he can see within range. Each mote hits its target automatically, dealing 2d4 + 2 force damage.

Note: Use this only if the Visionary is left outside of the experiment.

Sensory Lock.name: Sensory Lock
Sensory Lock.description:
Sensory Lock. The Curious can target one creature he can see within 30ft. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the save at the end of his turn to end the effect.

Note: Use this only if the Curious is left outside of the experiment.

Stormforger.name: Stormforger
Stormforger.description:
Weapon (quarterstaff), legendary (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, druid or wizard)

“Behold the power of the great storm!" the wizard shouted as the orb atop the staff began to swirl. "Feel its wrath and fear its might!" The winds howled, and bolts of lightning erupted from the staff, striking the ground and sending shock waves through the air.”

The Stormforger staff is carved from a single piece of lightning-struck wood. The staff has a glowing orb made of pure crystal at the top which pulsates with energy and contains miniature tempests within.

This staff is not meant for melee attacks but while you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged spell attack rolls and it has 10 charges. It regains 1d4 + 2 expended charges after a long rest. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 20, the staff regains 2d4 + 2 charges.

While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend its charges unleashing the following abilities using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier:

Tornado Takedown. Expending 2 charges allows you to summon a tornado that travels to a creature within 60ft. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save it takes [[/r 1d6]] bludgeoning damage and [[/r 2d6]] lightning damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and is not @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated}.

Aerial Ascension. Expending 5 charges you can harness the power of the tempest and summon a whirlwind beneath your feet, allowing flight for 10 minutes. The maximum altitude that can be reached while flying is 30ft.

Aerial Descent. If you are airborne after using Aerial Ascension, you can use your action to safely descend to the ground. This action does not consume any charges.

Thunderstorm of Misery. Expending 9 charges you can summoning a powerful storm around you in a 50ft radius for 1 minute. The storm creates dangerous terrain, making the ground slippery and filled with debris, making it difficult for creatures within the area of effect to move around. The winds, lightning strikes and heavy rain make it hard for creatures to see or hear, imposing disadvantage on any perception checks made while within the storm. The storm also unleashes bolts of lightning, forcing creatures within the affected area, to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take [[/r 8d6]] lightning damage, or half as much on a successful one.

The Coward CR1.description:
The Coward Quotes

  1. "Fear isn’t a weakness, it’s survival whispering in your ear."
  2. "Caution may seem like cowardice, but it has kept me here when others would have fallen."
  3. "They scoff at my fear, but isn’t it fear that keeps us from stepping into ruin?"
  4. "What they call hesitation, I call foresight."
  5. "Bravery is overrated. Sometimes running away is the wisest choice."
  6. "Without fear, there’s no sense of danger. Without danger, there’s no care for life."
  7. "They call me weak, but I see the risks they ignore. I see the cracks before they crumble."
  8. "The others push forward recklessly. Someone has to worry about what lies ahead."
  9. "You can call it cowardice if you like. I call it survival."

  4. "Emotions are fleeting, but knowledge is eternal."

  7. "Facts do not lie. It is people who twist them to fit their desires."

  8. "The greatest danger lies in standing still while the world moves forward."

This vial contains a green liquid.

When consumed, this potion completely cures all levels of Exhaustion caused by magical contamination and poison, such as the effects of the Specimen Room.

Arcane Shot.name: Arcane Shot
Arcane Shot.description:
As an action, you conjure an ethereal arcane bow. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 force damage. If the target is of Medium size or smaller, it is pushed 10ft away by the force of the arrow. The bow and arrow disappear after firing.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

Belt of Shocking (Rare) v2.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

"With the Belt of Shocking, everyone will experience an electrifying sensation, quite literally!"

The Belt of Shocking is a finely crafted accessory, made from leather. The buckle of the belt is fashioned in the shape of a stylized lightning bolt.

Electric Discharge. Once per short rest, as a bonus action, you can release electric arcs in a 5ft radius around you. Creatures within must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 2d6 lightning damage and are @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and avoid the incapacitated condition.

Wondrous Item (cape), rare (requires attunement)

"The spectral twin, born of intention, gracefully mirrors the subtleties of my motions."

The Cloak of Spectral Echoes appears as a flowing, midnight-blue garment adorned with silver threads that seem to weave in and out of reality.

The cloak has 3 charges. It regains expended charges after a long rest.

Weapon (quarterstaff), legendary (requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, druid or wizard)

“Behold the power of the great storm!" the wizard shouted as the orb atop the staff began to swirl. "Feel its wrath and fear its might!" The winds howled, and bolts of lightning erupted from the staff, striking the ground and sending shock waves through the air.”

The Stormforger staff is carved from a single piece of lightning-struck wood. The staff has a glowing orb made of pure crystal at the top which pulsates with energy and contains miniature tempests within.

This staff is not meant for melee attacks but while you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to ranged spell attack rolls and it has 10 charges. It regains 1d4 + 2 expended charges after a long rest. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 20, the staff regains 2d4 + 2 charges.

While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend its charges unleashing the following abilities using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier:

Tornado Takedown. Expending 2 charges allows you to summon a tornado that travels to a creature within 60ft. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save it takes [[/r 1d6]] bludgeoning damage and [[/r 2d6]] lightning damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and is not @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.TpkZgLfxCmSndmpb]{Incapacitated}.

Aerial Ascension. Expending 5 charges you can harness the power of the tempest and summon a whirlwind beneath your feet, allowing flight for 10 minutes. The maximum altitude that can be reached while flying is 30ft.

Aerial Descent. If you are airborne after using Aerial Ascension, you can use your action to safely descend to the ground. This action does not consume any charges.

Thunderstorm of Misery. Expending 9 charges you can summoning a powerful storm around you in a 50ft radius for 1 minute. The storm creates dangerous terrain, making the ground slippery and filled with debris, making it difficult for creatures within the area of effect to move around. The winds, lightning strikes and heavy rain make it hard for creatures to see or hear, imposing disadvantage on any perception checks made while within the storm. The storm also unleashes bolts of lightning, forcing creatures within the affected area, to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take [[/r 8d6]] lightning damage, or half as much on a successful one.

ADVENTURE SUMMARY.name: ADVENTURE SUMMARY
ADVENTURE SUMMARY.text:
A mysterious tower has appeared on the coast, causing violent storms and disrupting the natural order. Within the tower resides the fractured remnants of its creator, @UUID[Actor.7WjHNfX4PWEE1YIP]{The Architect}, whose failed experiment shattered his personality into five aspects: @UUID[Actor.qkJAdaRGhEk5CSXu]{The Scholar} (logic), @UUID[Actor.fHBGmHDIeDlMG9eP]{The Dreamer} (emotion), @UUID[Actor.ZOHYhK9nl6q4Nfq7]{The Visionary} (ambition), @UUID[Actor.5B7BWcyF2jB8peTd]{The Coward} (fear), and @UUID[Actor.9XjOpzeCG7YC6lz9]{The Curious} (wonder). Each aspect has its own agenda, shaped by the Architect’s failed experiment to sever an unwanted part of him.

The adventurers must traverse the tower’s levels, solving puzzles, navigating traps, and overcoming challenges, while deciding which aspects to aid and which to exclude from the experiment. Along the way, they uncover the tower’s secrets, including its unstable void-powered magic, its connection to a petrified blue dragon, and the wizard’s struggles with ambition, love, and regret.

The adventure combines exploration, moral dilemmas, and combat, challenging the adventurers to balance logic, emotion, ambition, fear, and curiosity as they unravel the mystery of the tower.

The adventure can be summarized in 3 acts:

Act 1: The Puzzle of the Entrance
The adventurers explore the lower levels of the tower, meet the five aspects representing the different personalities of the Architect, and solve the orb puzzle at the entrance. Completing the puzzle stabilizes the tower’s arcane flow and unlocks access to the upper levels.

Act 2: The Roof Confrontation
The adventurers ascend to the roof to retrieve energy cells required to power the experiment and reunite the fractured personalities of the Architect. On the roof, they face environmental hazards and battle voidling elementals drawn to the unstable energy.

Act 3: The Experiment and the Final Confrontation
In the Arcane Circle room, the adventurers power the experiment, solve the light-beam puzzle, and select a maximum of four aspects to reunite in the Architect’s mind. When the Architect is summoned, the excluded aspect exerts control over his mind, while any aspects whose quests were not completed turn hostile. The adventurers must defeat these enemies, stabilize the Architect, and determine the tower’s final fate.

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
The combat difficulty of this encounter can vary and depends on factors such as the level of the player characters, their magic items, the size of the group, the environment, the number of enemies, and the Challenge Rating of each enemy.

MECHANICS.name: MECHANICS
MECHANICS.text:
Macros for GM

  • @UUID[Macro.kfOzqfjgG8VQErb5]{Enable/Disable Regions}

    • Can be used on all maps. It enables or disables Region Behaviors. For example, you can use it to enable or disable teleporting regions so that players won’t be teleported when entering a specific region. For some regions (like stairs), it makes sense for the teleport behavior to always remain active. However, for others (such as puzzle-related areas), it may be more appropriate to activate the region behavior only after players have solved the puzzles, making the region’s activation logical within the context of the game.
      Since the macro is generic, it will display all regions with behaviors, such as weather suppression for indoor areas.

  • @UUID[Macro.pL9tL6WRxevy4dzt]{Turn On/Off Lights}

    • Can be used on @UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.oJ2hCQwm9QjTTvaM]{Lower Level 1: Storage} | @UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.JuU0tRHMY9VMyqXx]{Level 1: Entrance} | @UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.W5oyMESfEMDQf3qV]{Level 6: Arcane Circle}. Its purpose is to easily turn certain scene lights on or off.

  • @UUID[Macro.aoJCylLS71Pvq3Ln]{Rotate Lights}

    • Can be used on @UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.W5oyMESfEMDQf3qV]{Level 6: Arcane Circle}. Its purpose is to easily rotate certain lights in the scene and power on the experiment (turn on all lights).

  • @UUID[Macro.T5uKOQfZV5fPKLUh]{Summon Tokens}

    • Can be used on @UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.W5oyMESfEMDQf3qV]{Level 6: Arcane Circle}. Its purpose is to summon tokens onto the canvas in predefined locations.
      This macro does check if an actor is already on the map, and it will prevent summoning a duplicate of the same actor. However, the macro does not keep track of which spawn positions have already been used if you run it multiple times in separate actions. So if you summon one actor (which lands at the first position) and then re-run the macro later for a different actor, that second actor will also appear at that same first position.

  • @UUID[Macro.XGylSKw442aj9aXJ]{Trigger Trap}

    • Can be used on all maps but it is recommended for @UUID[JournalEntry.7gwobmg96g7RltZa.JournalEntryPage.LHTYFArNIsP4yFRB]{Level 3: Study}. Its purpose is to deal damage to the token that attempted to open the chest using an incorrect code.

GM Notes:

  • Some regions with teleportation behavior are intentionally disabled to prevent players from teleporting before solving certain puzzles.
    You can enable or disable the teleport regions using the provided macro or directly from Foundry Region Control.

  • It is normal for the custom macros to close when the GM changes the map. This behavior is intentional, as the information presented in the dialog becomes irrelevant once the map changes.

  • If the players attack and kill an aspect, it will disappear from the map, and the players will no longer be able to communicate with it by any means. Additionally, the aspect will not be able to participate in the experiment.

  • Be sure to check the Handout Journals for additional information—especially the Wizard’s Journal Notes, which can be found in various parts of the tower.

ADVENTURE HOOKS.name: ADVENTURE HOOKS
ADVENTURE HOOKS.text:
1. The Coastal Calamity

Violent storms have ravaged the coast, cutting off trade routes and flooding villages. Locals report that the storms began when a strange tower appeared near the shoreline. The adventurers are hired by desperate villagers to investigate the source of the storms and put an end to them.

2. A Village in Peril

An isolated fishing village near the tower is under constant assault from elementals. The villagers plead with the adventurers to stop the attacks and stabilize the region.

3. The Disrupted Arcane Council

A council of wizards sends a formal request for adventurers to investigate the tower. They warn that the tower’s unstable magic is interfering with their own experiments and could unravel important protective wards in the region.

TOWER LEVEL 1.name: TOWER LEVEL 1
TOWER LEVEL 1.text:
Entrance

Description

The Entrance Room contains a central crystalline magical device connected by multiple energy lines to eight glowing orbs. The device is unstable and linked to the tower's arcane systems. On the opposite side of the room, a stone throne is positioned between two larger orbs. A staircase leads upward, and another staircase descends to a lower level.

Puzzle

The puzzle in the entrance room involves eight energy orbs that can be turned on or off. To solve it, the adventurers must determine which orbs need to be activated and the correct sequence to activate them. The first clue is found in the @UUID[JournalEntry.Y3ga0FQtUAMPQNaU]{Handout: Codex of the Arcane Engine}, located in the Bedroom. If the adventurers bring the codex to the @UUID[Actor.qkJAdaRGhEk5CSXu]{Scholar}, he explains that each orb at the entrance is linked to specific rooms in the tower. The adventurers must identify which orbs are pulsing in each room and activate the corresponding orbs at the entrance in ascending order based on the tower's levels.

Hint: Pulsing orbs can be seen more clearly in the dark.

Solution: In the Entrance Room, there are two large orbs, but only one is pulsing. This orb must be pressed first. The next set of orbs is in the Specimen Room, where three of the five orbs are pulsing at varying speeds. These three orbs can be pressed in any order after the first. The final pulsing orb is located in the Bedroom and is the only orb in that room. At the entrance, the corresponding orb must be activated last to complete the sequence.

Outcome: The levitation glyph in the Bedroom is now active and provides access to the Arcane Circle room.

Hazards

The small orbs are interactive and can be switched on or off. Activating the orbs in the incorrect order cause the crystalline device to release harmful energy or summon elementals:

  • On the first incorrect activation, the crystalline magical device summons three elementals to attack the adventurers.

  • For each subsequent incorrect activation, the following effects occur in sequence:

    1. Sonic damage, use the Sonic Damage from the orb's abilities.

    2. Lightning damage, use the Lightning Damage from the orb's abilities.

    3. Necrotic damage.

After these three effects, if the adventurers continue pressing the orbs in the wrong sequence, the GM can choose which ability of the crystalline magical device to activate next.
Additionally, when the crystalline device triggers any of its harmful abilities due to an incorrect sequence, all the orbs turn off, forcing the adventurers to start the sequence again.

Note: The crystalline magical device cannot be destroyed. While players may attempt to attack it, it is immune to all types of damage.

Because of the tower's volatile arcane energy and chaotic weather, aerial movement is far too dangerous to attempt.
Climbing the tower requires DC 18 Strength (Athletics) check every round for climbing the polished surface. Failure results in a slip, losing 15ft of progress, and requiring a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw to avoid falling. A creature affected by the Spider Climb spell bypasses the need for climbing checks entirely.
Falling damage is 1d6 bludgeoning for every 10ft fallen. Each floor has a height of 14ft.
If they manage to climb to level 5, they will find a balcony with locked doors. A DC 16 Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check is required to pick the lock, or a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check to brute-force the door. Similarly, if they climb to level 6, they will encounter another set of locked doors with the same requirements. If they climb to level 7 and reach the roof, they will trigger a combat encounter.

TOWER LEVEL 2.name: TOWER LEVEL 2
TOWER LEVEL 2.text:
The Library

Description

The Library is located on Level 2 of the tower. It is a large, octagonal room with walls lined by bookshelves, each filled with numerous tomes, scrolls, and manuscripts. A central wooden walkway, illuminated by dim lanterns on either end, spans the room, connecting opposite sides of the chamber. Two staircases are present: one leading upward to the next floor and another descending to the lower level.

@UUID[Actor.qkJAdaRGhEk5CSXu]{The Scholar}

The Scholar, one of the wizard’s fractured aspects, appears in this room as an ethereal, translucent figure resembling a man. He is surrounded by open books and focused on deciphering an old text. When he notices the adventurers, he says:

"Ah, outsiders. Finally, someone with the intellect to end this mess."

Personality: Logical, analytical, and reserved. Prefers knowledge over action and is cautious about revealing too much information.

Some examples of responses he might give to adventurers' questions:

If asked who he is:
"I am a fragment, a mind shaped by logic."

If asked about this place:
"This is the library. It has seen better days, but its purpose remains intact if you know where to look."

If asked about what happened:
"An experiment gone wrong. The consequences, as you can see, have been catastrophic."

If asked about anything else in the tower:
"I'm afraid my memory is quite... fragmented. Likely a result of the experiment. I remember flashes, pieces, but the whole picture eludes me. Perhaps some answers lie within the tower itself..."

If asked about the orbs on the first floor before the book is retrieved he respond with the request.
"A sealed book bound in chains lies somewhere within the tower. Find it for me, and I will share everything I know."

Why can’t you find the book yourself?
"I am bound to this floor, a consequence of the experiment’s failure. My presence cannot extend beyond these walls."

If asked about the orbs on the first floor after retrieving the book, the Scholar continues to read for a little while before responding:
"Ah, the orbs at the entrance... each one is linked to specific rooms within the tower. Their pulsing indicates a connection to the tower’s arcane flow, a pattern, if you will. To stabilize the magic, you must observe which orbs are active in each room and replicate their order at the entrance. Begin with the lowest level and work your way upward, pressing the corresponding orbs in sequence."

If the adventurers ask about how to better observe the orbs, the Scholar can respond:
"The pulsing orbs are probably more noticeable in the dark."

Hazards

Falling damage is 1d6 bludgeoning for every 10ft fallen. Each floor has a height of 14ft.

Important Items

TOWER LEVEL 3.name: TOWER LEVEL 3
TOWER LEVEL 3.text:
The Study Room

Description

The Study Room contains a central wooden table surrounded by chairs. Shelves along the walls hold various tools, alchemical instruments, and jars labeled with unknown contents. A desk near the edge of the room displays additional notes, charts, and partially completed projects.

Two staircases provide access to other levels, one leading upward and one downward.

@UUID[Actor.ZOHYhK9nl6q4Nfq7]{The Visionary}

The Visionary, one of the wizard’s fractured aspects, is present in the room positioned near the desk, examining a schematic.

When the Visionary notices the adventurers, he turns toward them and says:

"Finally, someone with potential."

Personality: Ambitious, determined, and focused on progress. Values the future above all, often disregarding the past.

Some examples of responses he might give to adventurers' questions:

If asked who he is:
"I am the Visionary, the drive to achieve, to create, and to push beyond limits. A fragment of the mind that sought to overcome its flaws. Now I remain as a shadow of that ambition."

If asked about the tower:
"This tower was built as a vessel for a grand experiment. It was to separate and refine aspects of the self, to achieve perfection. What you see now are the remnants of that ambition."

If asked about the orbs from the first floor:
"The orbs? A minor piece of the larger puzzle. They may have their purpose, but our focus must remain on the experiment and what went wrong."

If asked about what happened:
"The experiment was meant to isolate one undesirable trait from the whole, an act of self-purification. But the energy became unstable. The process fractured everything, scattering the aspects and destabilizing the tower."

If asked how many aspects there are:
"There are five of us, fragments of what was once a whole. Some of them are less predictable, but they exist within this tower."

If asked about the Scholar:
"The Scholar? A fragment of reason, confined to his books and theories. He has his uses, knowledge is but a tool after all, but he lacks the drive to act."

If asked about anything else in the tower:
"Look, we must focus on what must be done. The details of the past are insignificant compared to the vision of what can be achieved. Seek the future, not the past."

Request:
"You must help me reunite the aspects. But first, go to the Arcane Circle room where the experiment took place. There lies an arcane device. With it, I can better understand what went wrong and what must be done to make things right."

If the adventurers bring the @UUID[JournalEntry.9ej6q4lJuSRlmX6v]{Arcane Device} to the Visionary, after a short inspection, he can say the following:
"Is what I suspected, the energy cells... Their calibration was always a challenge, given the unstable nature of the void energy. That instability, I believe, was the cause of the experiment’s failure. But now, I know how to align them properly. There should still be functional @UUID[JournalEntry.JfhUJ3tVp25bSmxV]{Energy Cells} on the roof. Retrieve them, and we can ensure the device works as intended this time."

After the adventurers bring the energy cells to the Visionary, he can say the following:
"Good, give me a moment. Now, you must absorb into the device the aspects you wish to participate in the experiment. There must be at least one, but no more than four. I demand that one of them be me if not the only one. My role is essential to the whole. Without me, none of this would be possible. Once the aspects are absorbed, take the device to the Arcane Circle room and place it on the stone table to power the experiment. If everything functions as intended, the wall crystals will emit magical light beams, and the absorbed aspects will be channeled into the enclosures, with violet arcane shields activating around them. To complete the sequence, redirect the light beams so that each connects to a crystal node on the arcane circle. The flow of light must move in a continuous anticlockwise direction to properly power the experiment."

Hazards

Falling damage is 1d6 bludgeoning for every 10ft fallen. Each floor has a height of 14ft.

Important Items

TOWER LEVEL 4.name: TOWER LEVEL 4
TOWER LEVEL 4.text:
The Specimen Room

Description

This level contains a series of display cases showcasing preserved specimens and artifacts. The room features a central case displaying a massive nautilus creature. Other cases hold insects pinned in frames, and other strange objects. Warm, golden light from glowing orbs highlights the displays.

Two staircases provide access to the levels above and below.

@UUID[Actor.9XjOpzeCG7YC6lz9]{The Curious}

The Curious, another aspect of the fractured wizard, resides here, studying the exhibits.

When the Curious notices the adventurers, he says:

"Oh, visitors! How wonderful! Have you seen the specimens? Aren’t they fascinating? I knew someone would come eventually."

Peronality: Enthusiastic and impulsive, they often dive into mysteries without caution, valuing discovery over safety.

Some examples of responses he might give to adventurers' questions:

If asked who he is:
"I am a seeker, a collector of wonders. I observe, I question, and perhaps, in time, I understand."

If asked about this place:
"A collection, a treasury of life’s diversity and peculiarities. Each piece tells a story, don’t you think?"

If asked about the orbs from the first floor:
"Orbs, you say? Devices of focus and control, perhaps. They are part of the tower's mechanisms, but their function escapes me. Maybe others can illuminate the matter."

If asked about what happened:
"An experiment unraveled, spilling chaos into order. I cannot say more without speculation, but the results... they are all around us."

If asked about the other aspects:
"Ah, an intriguing thought. I sense five of us, each holding something the others lack. It’s strange how we’re separate yet connected, isn’t it?"

If asked about anything else in the tower:
"Oh, the tower holds so many secrets, and I don't have all the answers..."

If asked about the odor:
"Odor? Hmm... curious indeed. I cannot perceive it myself, as I lack a physical body. But perhaps it is connected to the decay of these specimens? An unfortunate side effect of their... preservation methods and the residual magic saturating this place."

If the adventurers are poisoned, the Curious says:
Ah, I see the room's... lingering effect has taken hold. Unfortunate, but not entirely irreversible. Tell me outsiders, do you intend to reunite the aspects?"

If the adventurers express willingness, the Curious nods and continues:
"Good. Then I must insist on one condition: when the time comes, you will include me in the merging. Promise me this, and I will guide you where to find an antidote."

If the adventurers agree to the terms, he reveals:
"Very well. Beneath this tower, there lies a room... where darker purposes once guided experiments. There you may find an antidote. Proceed with caution. It is a place best left undisturbed."

Hazards

The Specimen Room has a faint but pervasive strange odor caused by decayed remains and magical contamination. For every minute adventurers spend in the room, they must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they become poisoned and gain 3 levels of Exhaustion. This Exhaustion cannot be removed by resting or sleeping. It requires magical healing, such as the use of a lesser restoration spell or similar effects that cure poison and exhaustion. On a successful save, they become immune to the effect.

Falling damage is 1d6 bludgeoning for every 10ft fallen. Each floor has a height of 14ft.

TOWER LEVEL 5.name: TOWER LEVEL 5
TOWER LEVEL 5.text:
The Bedroom

Description

In the center of this room is an arcane glyph engraved into the stone floor. The glyph emits a faint glow, indicating its magical properties. Above the glyph, the ceiling contains a sealed circular aperture. Activating the glyph opens the aperture and levitates individuals to the next floor. A bed is positioned against the western wall, accompanied by a small nightstands.

@UUID[Actor.fHBGmHDIeDlMG9eP]{The Dreamer}

Near the northern wall are three large mirrors. The Dreamer stands before them, studying the reflections.

When the Dreamer notices the adventurers, he says:

“Oh… you’ve come to fix us, haven’t you? I can sense your intentions.”
He gestures to the mirrors and adds, “Even in these reflections, I appear as though I am part of a dream.”

Personality: Gentle and empathetic. Seeks harmony but is often lost in thoughts of "what could be."

If asked about the mirrors:
“These mirrors… they reflect more than the present. They capture glimpses of what was, and sometimes, what could be. It’s not just my reflection I see. It’s… potential, perhaps? Or regret.”

If asked about the experiment:
“Ah, the folly of ambition. So much was risked in the name of progress, and yet here we are… fragments of what was once whole.”

If asked about anything else in the tower:
"The tower... it is a labyrinth of forgotten dreams. I feel its whispers, but their meaning escapes me."

If asked about the other aspects:
“Each of us carries a part of the wizard’s essence, yet we are so different. One dreams too big, unheeding of the cost. Another cold, calculating would sacrifice much for knowledge. I… I only wish for peace, but perhaps that’s my flaw.”

If asked about the chained book:

"If it is truly needed, I will not stop you."

If asked about the glyph:
“The glyph will lift those who stand on it to the next floor where the experiment was conducted.”

Request:
"There is something I yearn to see again. In the storage room, there lies a chest. Forgotten, neglected, yet holding something precious to me: a small locket. Will you bring it back to me?”

Hazards

Falling damage is 1d6 bludgeoning for every 10ft fallen. Each floor has a height of 14ft.

Important Items

TOWER LEVEL 6.name: TOWER LEVEL 6
TOWER LEVEL 6.text:
Arcane Circle

Description

The Arcane Circle is an octagonal room with eight crystals embedded in the walls. Three walls display paintings of the wizard in various scenes, possibly connected to the tower's history. Four walls feature enclosures, and at the northern end of the room, a stone table holds an @UUID[JournalEntry.9ej6q4lJuSRlmX6v]{Arcane Device}. In the center, an aperture leads to the room below, surrounded by energy lines forming an arcane circle with crystals positioned around the nodes. Two closed doors lead to an exterior ledge encircling the room. Metal ladders located at the north and south sides of the ledge provide access to the roof.

Puzzle (The Experiment)

If the adventurers investigate the @UUID[JournalEntry.9ej6q4lJuSRlmX6v]{Arcane Device}, they will notice its @UUID[JournalEntry.JfhUJ3tVp25bSmxV]{Energy Cells} are depleted. By bringing the device to the Visionary, they will learn it requires functional energy cells, which can be obtained from devices on the roof. After retrieving the energy cells, the adventurers must return to the Visionary to install them. This time, they will learn that they must absorb at least one aspect, but no more than four, into the arcane device. Once this is done, the adventurers must return the device to the Arcane Circle room to power the experiment. Once powered, the crystals on the walls will emit magical light beams, and the absorbed aspects will be channeled into the enclosures, with violet arcane shields activating around them. The adventurers must then solve the light beam puzzle to progress.

Note: While inside the enclosures, the aspects are dormant and incapable of any form of communication or interaction. If the adventurers choose to explore the tower again after the combat encounter, the GM should remove the tokens of any aspects left behind in the rooms.

Solution: To complete the puzzle, they must redirect the beams of light emitted by the wall crystals so that every beam illuminates a crystal node on the arcane circle. The light beams must flow in a continuous anticlockwise pattern to properly power the experiment.

Outcome: The aperture in the middle of the room will lock for 1 minute and @UUID[Actor.7WjHNfX4PWEE1YIP]{The Architect} materializes in the center, mentally unstable and dominated by the influence of the aspect excluded from the experiment. Any aspects in the enclosures whose requests were not fulfilled by the adventurers will emerge hostile. The adventurers must defeat the hostile aspects and deplete the Architect’s temporary hit points. Once stabilized, the Architect will regain calm and be able to speak normally, and the hostile aspects will disappear.

Hazards

Falling damage is 1d6 bludgeoning for every 10ft fallen. Each floor has a height of 14ft.

Important Items

@UUID[JournalEntry.9ej6q4lJuSRlmX6v]{Handout: Arcane Device}: This object can be taken to the Visionary for inspection.

TOWER LEVEL 7.name: TOWER LEVEL 7
TOWER LEVEL 7.text:
The Roof

Description

The roof of the tower is an open octagonal platform. At the center is an arcane energy coil emanating energy. Four vortex-like devices are positioned near the edges, with Voidling Elementals hovering around them.

There are two trapdoors, one to the north and one to the south of the platform, leading to the floor below. They automatically lock unless held open and can only be reopened by succeeding on a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check or a DC 20 Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check.

The Voidling Elementals become hostile if anyone approaches the vortex devices or the energy coil. Each vortex can summon elementals every turn, with no more than two elementals active per vortex at any time. Adventurers can destroy the vortexes by attacking them or using skill checks.

The platform is divided into three regions: Region 1 at the center, Region 2 in the middle, and Region 3 along the edge. When the first vortex device is destroyed, an arcane lightning field activates in Region 2. Destroying a second vortex device activates an arcane lightning field in Region 1, and destroying a third activates it in Region 3. If the fourth vortex device is destroyed, all arcane lightning fields disappear. The arcane lightning fields deal [[/r 1d8]]{1d8 lightning} damage to anyone who enters or starts their turn in the affected region.

The central energy coil can also be destroyed. This will disable all remaining vortex devices.

The adventurers can use the following skill checks to interact with the vortex structures and the arcane energy coil:

Vortex Structures

Skill Check: (DC 15) Arcana (Intelligence)

  • Success: The adventurer discovers how to weaken the vortex, granting advantage on all attacks for the rest of the combat.
  • Failure: The adventurer misinterprets the vortex’s energy and causes it to summon another Voidling Elemental.

Skill Check: (DC 20) Sleight of Hand (Dexterity)

  • Success: The adventurer disables or destabilizes part of the vortex, deactivating it.
  • Failure: An arcane lightning discharge is triggered in Region 2 of the platform, lasting for 1 round and dealing 1d8 lightning damage to any creature within the area or starting their turn there.

Arcane Energy Coil

Skill Check: (DC 15) Investigation (Intelligence)

  • Success: The adventurer uncovers hidden mechanisms that weaken the coil, causing all attacks against it to deal an extra 2d6 damage for the rest of the combat.
  • Failure: The coil releases an unstable surge of electricity, dealing 4d6 lightning damage to the adventurer and knocking him prone.

Skill Check: (DC 15) Athletics (Strength)

  • Success: The adventurer inflicts structural damage to the coil, removing 50 hit points.
  • Failure: The coil releases an unstable surge of electricity, dealing 4d6 lightning damage to the adventurer and knocking him prone.

Hazards

Because of the rain, the platform surface is slippery and will be treated as difficult terrain.

Falling damage is 1d6 bludgeoning for every 10ft fallen. Each floor has a height of 14ft.

Important Items

@UUID[JournalEntry.JfhUJ3tVp25bSmxV]{Handout: Arcane Energy Cell}: Every arcane devices on the roof have one of this.

TOWER LOWER LEVEL 1.name: TOWER LOWER LEVEL 1
TOWER LOWER LEVEL 1.text:
Storage

Description

The Storage room is shrouded in magical darkness. The adventurers are unable to see anything within the room but can hear faint whispers that seem to come from every direction.

@UUID[Actor.5B7BWcyF2jB8peTd]{The Coward}

The whispers belong to the Coward, an aspect of the wizard, who lingers in the shadows. Its voice is trembling filled with fear and mistrust:

"Who's there? Stay back! I won't let you hurt me! You... you're like the others, aren't you? Always seeking... always taking. Leave me be!"

Personality: Fearful, wary, and distrusting. Reluctant to take risks but willing to cooperate if safety is assured.

If asked who it is:
"I... I am nothing important. Just a shadow, a remnant of what once was. Please, don’t ask me more. I can’t bear to explain..."

If asked why it is hiding:
"Hiding? I am not hiding... I am surviving! The others… They’re too bold, too reckless. You wouldn’t understand..."

If asked about the other aspects:
"The others... doesn’t see things the way I do. One values logic and reason but dismisses fear. Another is lost in dreams, too kind and distracted to notice dangers. The worst of all the one with ambition with no thought for the consequences. And then there’s the one who pushes boundaries, endlessly probing without understanding the risks. Fear is what keeps them all grounded, what holds them back from ruin. Without me, the whole wouldn’t survive."

If asked about the magical darkness:
"The darkness? It is my refuge, my shield. Without it... I would be exposed. Vulnerable."

If asked about anything else in the tower:
"The tower? Oh, it's full of dangers, I’m sure of it! I don’t dare to dwell on its mysteries... Don’t poke around too much, who knows what can be awaken?"

If asked about the chamber below the tower that the Curious mentioned:
"The chamber? No... no, I won’t speak of that place! It’s filled with... with pain, suffering, and things that should never have been done. The memories alone make me shiver."

If asked about the reunification:
"Yes, I would. I am the part that understands what it means to be afraid. Without fear, there is no care for safety, no planning for what could go wrong. The others call me weak, but isn’t fear what keeps us alive? It’s what ensures survival. Isn’t it necessary? Without me, I fear the wizard would not survive the dangers that lie ahead."

Request:
"If... if you truly intend to reunify us, I have one plea. Do not include the Visionary. That one always so bold, so determined to chase grand ambitions without considering the risks. The Visionary would push toward ruin, blinded by dreams of what could be, ignoring the dangers of what is. Without him, perhaps there’s a chance for survival, for caution to prevail. Please... promise me this."

If reassured or comforted:
"You... you don’t seem like the others. Maybe... maybe you mean no harm. But I still cannot trust you. Not yet. Words are easy to speak, but intentions... they’re harder to know. Stabilize the tower’s magic, and perhaps then I will trust you."

Note: After the adventurers stabilize the tower’s magic by completing the puzzle in the Entrance room, the Coward will disable the darkness in the storage.

Important Items

TOWER LOWER LEVEL 2.name: TOWER LOWER LEVEL 2
TOWER LOWER LEVEL 2.text:
Torture Chamber

Description

This lower level features a divided layout with several distinct areas. To the left, a study area contains shelves, a desk with papers and books, and glass containers holding mysterious objects. Adjacent to it is a small storage area with scattered tools and materials. A central hallway connects to several rooms. On the right, a large space with a massive dragon-like creature sculpted in stone, bound by heavy chains, dominates the room.

VOIDLING ELEMENTAL.name: VOIDLING ELEMENTAL
VOIDLING ELEMENTAL.text:
VOIDLING ELEMENTAL

Armor Class: 13 (Natural Armor)

Hit Points: 12 (2d8 + 2)

Speed: Fly 30 ft.

Attributes:

  • Strength: 10 (+0)
  • Dexterity: 14 (+2)
  • Constitution: 14 (+2)
  • Intelligence: 8 (-1)
  • Wisdom: 12 (+1)
  • Charisma: 10 (-0)

Senses: Blindsight 60 ft.

Damage Immunities: Acid, Necrotic, Poison

Resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Slashing

Condition Imunities: Blinded, Charmed, Grappled, Paralized, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained

Vulnerabilities: Radiant

Challenge: 1 (200 XP)

Appearance: A Voidling Elemental appears as a swirling mass of dark purple, semi transparent energy.

Actions

Void Spark. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

Features

  1. Multiattack. The Voidling Elemental makes two attacks with Void Spark.

  2. Incorporeal Movement. The Voidling Elemental can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.

    It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

THE ARCHITECT.name: THE ARCHITECT
THE ARCHITECT.text:
THE ARCHITECT

Armor Class: 15 (Mage Armor)

Hit Points: 57 (10d6 + 20)

Speed: 30 ft.

Attributes:

  • Strength: 10 (+0)
  • Dexterity: 14 (+2)
  • Constitution: 14 (+2)
  • Intelligence: 18 (+7 Proficient)
  • Wisdom: 12 (+1)
  • Charisma: 12 (+1)

Resistances: Lightning

Challenge: 5 (1800 XP)

Appearance: The Architect wears a dark robe and carry a staff topped with a glowing crystal ball. Small arcs of lightning occasionally travel along the staff's surface.

Spellcasting

The wizard is an 8th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): Ray of Frost

1st level (4 slots): Mage Armor, Magic Missile, Shield

2nd level (3 slots): Mirror Image

3rd level (3 slots): Counterspell, Lightning Bolt

4th level (2 slots): Greater Invisibility

Features

Void Channeling. After the wizard casts a spell, up to two Voidling Elementals are summoned in unoccupied spaces within 10ft of him.

The Architect Quotes

Unstable

General Lines (Influenced by Any Aspect):

  1. "This... this isn’t right! Pieces... missing... too many cracks to hold together!"

  2. "I feel them! Pulling at me... too loud, too loud!" "Why did you do this? Why didn’t you listen? It’s broken—it’s all broken!"

Specific Influences:

  1. Scholar Influence: "Logic... fractured. Knowledge slipping through my hands! Why didn’t you fix it properly?"

  2. Visionary Influence: "You held me back! Too timid, too blind to what must be done! I could have achieved perfection!"

  3. Dreamer Influence: "Dreams... haunting me. Memories of what could have been. You should have let it go!"

  4. Curious Influence: "I can’t stop asking... what else? What could have been? Too many questions—no answers!"

  5. Coward Influence: "Fear... drowning me. Why didn’t you stop it? Why did you let this happen?"

Stable

  1. "You’ve restored me... Thank you for pulling me from the abyss."

  2. "What you’ve done here... it cannot have been easy. For that, you have my respect."

  3. "You’ve given me the chance to move forward, and for that, I am in your debt."

POST-ENCOUNTER.name: POST-ENCOUNTER
POST-ENCOUNTER.text:
The Architect Personality Examples

Balanced Architect

Outcome:
The adventurers successfully include a mix of aspects, creating a balanced Architect personality.

Goals:

  • Work to stabilize the tower, ensuring its magic no longer disrupts the surrounding environment.
  • Rebuild his reputation as a wizard by addressing past mistakes and offering aid to those affected by the tower's instability.
  • Study the lessons of his failure, striving to create without repeating past errors.
  • Use the tower as a beacon of arcane knowledge and exploration, inviting scholars and adventurers to assist in its restoration.
  • Research safer alternatives to void energy to power the tower.

Ambitious Architect

Outcome:
The Visionary dominates the Architect, making him focused on ambition and grand achievements.

Goals:

  • Resume experiments, pushing the limits of magic to achieve unparalleled advancements, regardless of risk.
  • Seek out powerful artifacts or sources of energy to further their goals.
  • He will focus on what can be gained through bold action.
  • Use the tower as a staging ground for greater magical endeavors.
  • Harness the tower’s teleportation capabilities to expand his influence and projects.

Emotional Architect

Outcome:
With the Dreamer in control, the Architect becomes more empathetic and introspective, but less decisive.

Goals:

  • Focus on repairing relationships and making amends for past mistakes.
  • Avoid further experimentation, fearing the consequences of failure.
  • Redirect the tower’s purpose toward artistic or peaceful endeavors.
  • Seek closure for his emotional struggles, perhaps attempting to reconnect with people from his past.

Logical Architect

Outcome:
With the Scholar in control, the Architect becomes focused on reason and order.

Goals:

  • Methodically rebuild the tower, stabilizing its arcane systems.
  • Approach every action with precision and logic, ignoring emotional or moral considerations.
  • Use the tower as a repository for knowledge and a center for arcane research.
  • Develop fail-safes to prevent future instability in the tower.
  • Pursue perfection in all things.

Fearful Architect

Outcome:
With the Coward in control, the Architect becomes overly cautious and paranoid.

Goals:

  • Shut down the tower’s magical systems, fearing further instability.
  • Isolate himself, focusing on self-preservation rather than external goals.
  • Abandon his ambition, believing it will only lead to ruin.
  • Reinforce the tower with defensive measures to prevent intrusion or experimentation.
  • Focus solely on survival and ensuring nothing destabilizes the tower again.

Curious Architect

Outcome:
With the Curious dominating, the Architect becomes consumed by wonder and a desire to explore the unknown.

Goals:

  • Restart the experiment, fascinated by the possibilities it holds, regardless of past failures.
  • Expand the tower’s capabilities, turning it into a hub for exploration and discovery.
  • Seek out other planes, artifacts, or phenomena to study and understand.
  • Use the tower to delve into the mysteries of the void and other realms.
  • Embrace discovery over caution, potentially repeating past mistakes.

To reveal the chamber, three rare gems must be collected and placed in the altar within the temple. Each gem is attuned to a different aspect of the storm (rain, thunder, and lightning) and guarded by elemental guardians.

Handout: Journal Note in the Storage.name: Handout: Journal Note in the Storage

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text:
"Here lie the remnants of what I could not finish, ideas and ambitions left to gather dust. Some things are easier to abandon than others. Yet, no matter how deeply I bury them, certain memories refuse to stay forgotten."

DC 18 Investigation to find this journal note.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text: A silver key that unlocks the doors in the Bedroom and Arcane Circle.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text: This device holds four energy cells. They seem depleted.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text: "Perfection is not born, it is crafted. My mind, my heart are at odds. A single flaw taints the whole. If I can excise it, I will finally achieve balance. No more… weakness."

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text: "That magic item she left behind brings back memories every time I see it, pulling me out of focus. But I can't bring myself to get rid of it either. I can't... Maybe I should seal it somehow. At least it would give me something to do, rather than linger in this bleak state."

Handout: Journal Note in Study Room 1.name: Handout: Journal Note in Study Room 1

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text: "Time feels different within these walls. Days and nights blur together, consumed by the work. I wonder if this is progress or merely obsession."

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text:
From my desk, I see the top of the six pillars beyond the window but their number is the last thing I need. First, the geometric shapes of one and then the sides of the middle shape can reveal the answer.

So silly, but fun. They say time heals everything. But for me, time is too important. I can't let it pass while I do nothing. Maybe I should make more of these little projects... or maybe, just maybe, something bigger. Something that can give focus to this doleful state I'm in.


Solution: The adventurers must find a three-digit number. The desk is located in the Study Room. If the adventurers look through the window from the desk, they will see six pillars, which corresponds to the note: "their number is the last thing I need." Thus, the last digit is 6.

Each pillar features three geometric shapes: a square, an octagon, and a diamond. The note continues: "First, the geometric shapes of one." This means the first digit is 3, representing the number of shapes on each pillar.

Finally, the middle shape on each pillar is an octagon, and the octagon has 8 sides, fulfilling the note: "and then the sides of the middle shape." This makes the second digit 8.

Answer: 386

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text:
From Scale To Void: The Evolution of Magic

This journal explains that the tower was initially powered by the arcane energy of a blue dragon, raised from an egg in those rooms. The wizard chose to petrify the dragon, fearing that its growing power might exceed his control. To sustain the tower's operations, he shifted to drawing energy from the arcane void. However, the text notes that this source is far less stable, with potential risks to the tower's structural integrity and magical systems. Diagrams and notes highlight the transition process and the vulnerabilities of relying on the volatile energy of the void.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text: "This room was meant to be a place of rest, but I find no peace here. My mind races even in the quiet hours"

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text: "Some sacrifices weigh heavier than others. It is easy to justify them in the name of progress, but harder to forget the cost."

Handout: Codex of the Arcane Engine.name: Handout: Codex of the Arcane Engine

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text:
This book contains instructions and explanations detailing how some of the mechanisms and magic of the tower function. For instance, it describes the crystal device at the entrance as a regulator for the tower’s arcane energy flow. This device is also capable of teleporting the entire tower to pre-designated locations. Any disturbances in the flow of magic are reflected in the glowing patterns of the magic orbs embedded in the tower's structures.

To reset and stabilize the flow of magic, the book outlines a specific procedure: pressing the orbs of the crystal device in a particular sequence. Failure to perform this sequence correctly may result in further disruption to the tower's magical systems.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION
DESCRIPTION.text: "The dragon exceeded all expectations, though I hesitated far longer than I should have before taking decisive action. That hesitation has cost me before."

This magic chest has a strange keyhole with an inscription engraved around it.

The adventurers must speak the word "Love" to open the chest.

The chest holds:

  • a locket with a tiny portrait: They can bring this item to the Dreamer.

  • @UUID[Item.9CmHp6P5ByUh9pWC]{Rod of Lies} This magic item is an optional reward.

DESCRIPTION.name: DESCRIPTION

"Imagination is my greatest gift and my greatest curse. I lose myself in dreams of what could be, yet I accomplish nothing. My emotions cloud my judgment. They hold me back. Perhaps I would be stronger if I let go of this… softness."

DC 20 Investigation to find this journal note.

Obsidian Sentinel.description:
The Obsidian Sentinel is an encounter set within a volcanic mountain, where a powerful forge lies hidden. This forge, built by an ancient clan of dwarves, harnesses the mountain's molten core to fuel its mystical creations. You can expect a richly detailed environment filled with dynamic creatures that bring the battle to life.

Within the Obsidian Forge, players will face the Obsidian Sentinel, a guardian crafted from dark, volcanic glass. The Sentinel is protected and enhanced by three magical shards that provide critical buffs, making it a challenging adversary.

As a reward for their efforts, players who defeat the Obsidian Sentinel can claim its magic set: the Obsidian Sentinel Scimitar and Shield. These magic items offer unique abilities when wielded together.

All creatures in this encounter have animated tokens, adding a visual flair that enhances the immersion. A comprehensive journal is included, providing the Game Master with all the necessary lore, descriptions, and tactical information to run the encounter smoothly.

LORE.name: LORE
LORE.text: The Obsidian Forge was created thousands of years ago by a powerful clan of dwarves, renowned for their mastery of both metallurgy and magic. They built the forge deep within the heart of a volcanic mountain, harnessing the mountain's molten core to fuel their creations. This forge was designed to craft weapons that instill fear and dread in all who opposed them, capable of influencing the fate of entire kingdoms. To protect their greatest secrets and creations, the dwarves forged the Obsidian Sentinel, an eternal guardian that stands ever vigilant against intruders.

  • Dexterity: 16 (+3)

Condition Immunities: Bleeding, Blinded, Charmed, Cursed, Deafened, Diseased, Exhaustion, Frightened, Incapacitated, Paralyzed, Poisoned, Prone, Stunned, Transformed, Unconscious

Challenge: 3 (700 XP)

Appearance: The Sentinel is composed from dark, volcanic glass. The surface of its body is layered with sharp, angular plates, resembling a natural armor formed by the solidified lava.

At the center of its chest, a blazing core of molten lava can be seen, glowing with intense light. This core radiates heat and seems to pulse with the energy that powers the Sentinel, while it hovers above the ground, propelled by a constant jet of fiery energy emanating from its lower torso.

The Sentinel's head is crowned with a helmet-like structure, with a pair of glowing eyes that shine with the same intensity as its core. The eyes seem to pierce through the darkness, constantly vigilant and ready to detect any intruders.

Actions

  1. Multiattack. The Obsidian Sentinel makes two melee attacks.

Features

  1. Magic Resistance. The Obsidian Sentinel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

  2. Obsidian Grip. The Sentinel cannot be disarmed by any means, including spells or abilities that would force it to drop its weapon.

ADVENTURE HOOK.name: ADVENTURE HOOK
ADVENTURE HOOK.text:
The Scholar's Request: An eccentric scholar believes the Obsidian Forge contains ancient texts and blueprints detailing forgotten technologies. They offer a substantial reward for any documents or artifacts the adventurers can recover.

The Dragon's Hoard: A dragon's hoard, believed to be hidden in the depths of the Obsidian Forge, has attracted the attention of both the adventurers and dragon hunters.

The Rival Adventurers: A rival group of adventurers has entered the Obsidian Forge, seeking glory and riches. However, they haven't returned. Their guild hires the players to find out what happened and, if necessary, complete the rival group's mission.

The Missing Smith: A renowned blacksmith has gone missing after seeking out the legendary Obsidian Forge, hoping to craft a weapon of unparalleled power. The adventurers are hired by the blacksmith's apprentice to find and rescue their master.

MECHANICS.name: MECHANICS
MECHANICS.text:
1. You can safely rename Obsidian Sentinel NPC or the Shards.

  2. Shard abilities can be used multiple times. For example, if the encounter is too easy, the shards can use their abilities on each other.

  3. The Obsidian Sentinel is already equipped with the Scimitar and Shield.

  4. How to stop a buff from a shard:

    • Delete the Effect: To stop a buff from a shard, delete its corresponding effect from the target (e.g., removing the "Vitality Beam" effect from the Obsidian Sentinel will also remove the canvas animation and the +150 temp HP).

    • Use Deactivation: Using the Deactivation activity (this option works only with the BLFX Assets & Animation Editor module).

DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.name: DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS
DIFFICULTY ADJUSTMENTS.text:
The combat difficulty of this encounter can vary and depends on factors such as the level of the player characters, their magic items, the size of the group, the environment, the number of enemies, and the Challenge Rating of each enemy.

Example Encounter Difficulty Estimations for CR3 Boss and three Minions with CR of 1/4 each:

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 3 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be deadly.

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 4 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be hard.

  • For a group of 4 player characters at level 5 without considering magic items, this encounter is estimated to be medium or easy if at least one party member have bludgeoning damage.

The easiest way to adjust the difficulty of the encounter is by changing the hit points, armor or the damage of the monsters.

TACTICS.name: TACTICS
TACTICS.text:
1. The Sentinel will focus on protecting the Shards.

  2. He will use Dreadful Protector strategically, then focus on attacking an enemy that is not frightened.

  3. The Shards will provide buffs as soon as they can. When damaged in melee, they will use the Disengage action to move away from attackers.
